cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 430 miles SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northeast across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle, then expected to sweep across the Southeast U.S. and emerge over the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Apalachicola–Panama City, FL (northern Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida west-central coast including Tampa Bay south of Yankeetown to near Clearwater Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL (storm-surge warning zone)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle and west-central Florida, then inland across GA/SC and out over the Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Friday night into early Saturday, especially in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in and near Tampa Bay including Port Manatee as onshore winds build ahead of landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with isolated totals near 5 inches, producing brief freshwater flooding in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands, rough seas and high waves hampering vessel movements and cargo operations.
